bibl.title: Military Orders for Walter Reed, William H. Forwood, Charles K. Winne, and Harry O. Perley, March 27, 1895

div1.p: Sternberg requests that Forwood, Winne, Reed, and Perley be sent as delegates to the American Medical Association meeting in Baltimore, Maryland, Mary 7-10, 1895. The letter, endorsements, and special orders are dated March 27, 1895 to March 30, 1895. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from George Miller Sternberg to the Adjutant General, May 27, 1895
div1.opener:
All official communications to this Office should be addressed “To the Surgeon General, U. S. Army, Washington, D. C.”
SUBJECT: Detail of Medical Officers to attend meeting of American Medical
Association, Baltimore, Maryland.
In reply refer to No.
War Department,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, March 27, 1895.
To the
ADJUTANT GENERAL OF THE ARMY,
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to request that the following named medical officers
may be detailed as delegates to represent the Medical Department of the
Army at the annual meeting of the American Medical Association, to meet in
Baltimore, Maryland, May 7 to 10, 1895.

Lieutenant Colonel William H. Forwood, Deputy Surgeon General, U. S.
Army, Soldiers' Home, Washington, D. C.
Major Charles K. Winne, Surgeon, U. S. Army, Fort McHenry, Maryland.

Major Walter Reed, Surgeon, U. S. Army, Surgeon General's Office,
Washington, D. C.

Captain Harry O. Perley, Assistant Surgeon, U. S. Army, Baltimore,
Maryland.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, G.M. Sternberg Surgeon General,
U. S. Army.

div1.head: Special Orders, No. 75, March 30, 1895
div1.p:
SPECIAL ORDERS, }
No. 75. }

HEADQUARTERS OF THE ARMY,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, March 30, 1895.
Extract.

2. By direction of the Secretary of War, the following-named
officers are detailed to represent the Medical Department of the
Army as delegates at the annual meeting of the American Med-
ical Association to be held at Baltimore, Maryland, May 7 to
10, 1895:

They will proceed from their respective stations in time to
reach Baltimore on May 7, and upon the adjournment of the
meeting will return to their proper stations. The travel en-
joined is necessary for the public service.

BY COMMAND OF LIEUTENANT-GENERAL SCHOFIELD:
GEO. D. RUGGLES,
Adjutant General.

WALTER REED,
SURGEON, U. S. ARMY.
